citations.narrative:
The carrier has not developed and documented a contingency plan. A plan is important to be prepared for potential
disasters or emergencies that could affect the health and well-being of the animals in transport. The contingency plan
should include a detailed strategy to address the needed handling, treatment, transportation, housing, and care of the
animals in the event of an emergency or disaster. Correct by developing and documenting an appropriate contingency
plan available for review upon USDA inspections.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.134 
   
Contingency planning. 
The carrier has not developed and documented a contingency plan. A plan is important to be prepared for potential 
disasters or emergencies that could affect the health and well-being of the animals in transport. The contingency plan 
should include a detailed strategy to address the needed handling, treatment, transportation, housing, and care of the 
animals in the event of an emergency or disaster. Correct by developing and documenting an appropriate contingency 
plan available for review upon USDA inspections. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative. 
 
 n
